alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:46PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Martin, central Knott, Floyd and Pike Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 846 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Oppy to Dwale to Soft Shell. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Warfield, Oppy, Pilgrim, Whitepost, Coalpoint, Hatfield Station, Beauty, Lovely, Rural and Laura around 850 PM EDT. McCombs, Justell, Betsy Layne, Harold, Boldman and Aluba around 855 PM EDT. Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Hi Hat, Burton, Gulnare, Orkney, Halo, East McDowell, McDowell and Coal Run around 900 PM EDT. Wheelwright, Ligon, Melvin, Buckhorn Hollow, Beaver, Piso, Jarad, Craynor, Heenan and Zebulon around 905 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Meta, Virgie, Jonancy, Varney, Myra, Heisey, Conder, Raccoon, Canada, Sidney, Dorton, Kimper, Shelbiana, Turkey Creek, Forest Hills, Mcandrews, Rockhouse, Huddy, Lookout, Hardy, Belfry, Garden Village, Chloe, Belcher, Marrowbone, Buskirk, Ashcamp, Coleman and Fishtrap Lake. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 9 and 20. U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 15. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 2 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
